oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rohphosphatmobilisierung von Sommerweizen, Weißlupine und Ackerbohne in einer Fruchtfolge
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Steffens, Prof. Dr. Diedrich
Stamm, Roland
Yan, PD Dr. Feng
Leithold, Prof. Dr. Guenter
Schubert, Prof. Dr. Sven
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Composting and manuring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In organic farming rock phosphate is used as a mineral P fertilizer, although the agronomic efficiency is limted. The objective of this study was to investigate in field and pot experiments the mobilization of rock phosphate by P-efficient plants (white lupin and faba bean) and the P availability for P-inefficient plants (spinach and maize) during a crop rotation in 2002/2003 and 2003/2004. The P uptake of spinach was higher in a crop rotation with white lupin and faba bean than in a crop rotation with summer wheat. In pot experiments the application of new basic slag phosphate (CaHPO4) resulted to a higher P uptake of the plants than rock phosphate.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Steffens, Prof. Dr. Diedrich; Stamm, Roland; Yan, PD Dr. Feng; Leithold, Prof. Dr. Guenter and Schubert, Prof. Dr. Sven (2005) Rohphosphatmobilisierung von Sommerweizen, Weißlupine und Ackerbohne in einer Fruchtfolge. [Rock phosphate mobilization by summer wheat, white lupin, and faba bean in a crop rotation.] In: Heß, J and Rahmann, G (Eds.) Ende der Nische, Beiträge zur 8. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, kassel university press GmbH, Kassel.
